results.title: Carmel: storyteller
results.brief_description: Carmel is a retired school teacher, wife, mother and grandmother. Her family’ s life dramatically changed when she was diagnosed with early onset memory loss. With her husband, she tells their story and looks positively in the face of an unknown future. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Max and Noel Oliver's story
results.brief_description:
Alzheimer’s sufferer Max together with his wife Noel have told a story for their granddaughters that celebrates their life together as well as capturing Max’s memories of his son, the children’s father, who died when they were very young. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.
You can create your own Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or visit www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Peg: a life to remember
results.brief_description: Peg and Bryan have been trekking all over the world since 1987. Bryan recalls their travels and the great times spent with his wife, who now has Alzheimer’s disease. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Passionate pursuits
results.brief_description: This story was created for Robin Hodder’s grandchildren to celebrate his extraordinary achievements as an Olympic sportsman, a husband of 38 years and the world’s greatest dad. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Sigmund Freud's Dora (E)
results.creator_credit: Jane Weinstock, Andrew Tyndall, Claire Pajaczkowska and Anthony McCall
results.brief_description: A critique of the representation of women in psychoanalytic discourse is linked, in the form of an ‘essay’, with modes of representation of women’s sexuality in the visual media. Sigmund Freud’s case history of Dora (‘Fragments of an Analysis of a Case of Hysteria’ published in 1905) is ‘re-read’ in three sections: an argument over the politics of psychoanalysis; a thematic linking of psychoanalytic discourse/pornographic film/advertising; and questions, in the form of post cards from Dora, posed about the way women look at themselves. Warning: sexually explicit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Weinstock, Andrew Tyndall, Claire Pajaczkowska and Anthony McCall

holdings.name: 16mm film; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Memories for mum
results.brief_description: Since emigrating from Malta in the 60’s, Tess and her husband have faced many challenges living in Australia and raising their boys. As Tess is now suffering from Alzheimer’s disease, her husband and sons pay tribute to a truly great woman. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Helath and the Alzheimer’s Association.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: A Letter for Marie
results.brief_description: South African born Marie has been diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease. Her husband, Tom, speaks of their 33-years together and of the good times still to come. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage
results.brief_description: Undertaken in partnership with Alzheimer’s Australia, Vic Memory’s Voice captures the stories of ten people impacted by dementia. These powerful stories examine the complexities of the condition ‘ the losses, the adjustments and the need to move forward ‘ preserving the spirit of the families involved and creating life long tributes to personal achievement.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Sight and sound
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Nathan Clavier, Don Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Lessons take on new life and meaning for children through the magic of films, filmstrips and radio. Everybody goes to the movies, and directly or indirectly learns much of the world. If ordinary movies illumine minds, how much more can be done with specially designed films in schools. We see, for example, how through a film, a class of children “jumps a continent” to visit Mexico, how a filmstrip on cutouts stimulates creative activity; how a radio broadcast can make what might have been a drab history period spring into new, imaginative life. Thanks to “sight and sound,” learning becomes an adventure.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gudrun Parker, Nathan Clavier, Don Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada
